properties.name: Asleep and ditching class.
properties.description: Posted by YenviousI was waken up by my roommate at around 1pm. They were in the living room watching the news, and he came in and said, "You\'d better wake up soon, terrorists have just bombed the world trade center." I thought it was a joke. The first thing I saw of it was the footage of the 2nd tower collapsing. It was bizzare. -- This was a strange place to live. I drank my first absinthe with the folks I lived with here, all older than me by 8 or 9 years, and the only reason we left was that Meagan didn\'t pay the rent and the landlords evicted us.

properties.name: Blue Dude Trailers
properties.description: Posted by YenviousMy mom and I lived in this trailer park for a few years, until she passed away. It was a nice little place, though, and I enjoyed a lot of my time there. The park is in back of the Hindu Temple, and the bells and chating would sometimes wake me up on the weekends. I miss my mom.

properties.name: Budlong
properties.description: Posted by Yenvious 2302 budlong ave, 90007I lived here over two years, and had an amazing bunch of roomates. It was this house in which I established my own character, my film philosophies, in which I fell in love with my wife, and in which I drank too much wine and passed out on multiple occassions. Even with all the good memories, this house was tainted by the evil landlords/con-artists/scientologists/hypnotists. I kid not.

properties.name: Calabasas Home
properties.description: Posted by Yenvious  26043 mulholland hwy, calabasas, caThis is one of two places I consider my childhood homes. I lived here from when I was 5 or 6 until my freshman year in college, and I even came back for a semester during sophmore year. This place was amazing, and if I ever can, I\'ll buy it back.

properties.name: Mountain House
properties.description: Posted by Yenvious3506 parrish ave, 90065A cupboard for a room, but an amazing view. This house is up on Mt. Washington, and it was built by the old man living next door. He gave me some of his old shirts. I loved this place, and I miss it.

properties.name: The Evanston Apartments
properties.description: Posted by Yenvious630 south kenmore ave, 90005Here is the first apartment I shared with my wife. It was nice, but a bit cramped. I finished my first feature film while living here.

properties.name: Tiny House
properties.description: Posted by Yenvious338 west 33rd st, 90007This place was a tiny house on the other side of the 110, surrounded by warehouses, and dangerous territory at night. The house was cut up into 4 different "apartments", and I think there were about 20 people living there. Rent was cheap. I was a freshman in college, living with 4 other seniors. My roomate had a sneezing problem. Every morning he would sneeze at least 20 times, maybe more. And he woke up 3 hours before I had to. But... I did spend a lot of time playing Thief II here, which was great.

properties.name: True Home.
properties.description: Posted by Yenvious  lubao and hatteras, woodland hills, caThis is where I lived with my mom from the time I was born until we had to move to a trailer park. We were there during the \'94 quake, and we had to move out while the house was repaired. But it was a great place. More than anywhere else, I miss this place, and I still dream of it. I had a treehouse and a skate ramp that my mom built for me, and I could play with my ninja turtles all day long. I\'m glad I kept those.
